fixes.name: Title Date Filter
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR endDateParam = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
VAR maxDate =
    VAR wd = WEEKDAY(TODAY())
    RETURN
        SWITCH(
            wd,
            1, TODAY() - 2,
            2, TODAY() - 3,
            TODAY() - 1
        )
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    IF(maxDate = 'migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)'[RpDate], 1, 0),
    IF('migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)'[RpDate] = endDateParam, 1, 0)
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Recreated the Tableau IF logic as a DAX measure. Parameter references were replaced with SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]) per rules (Use Custom Date and End Date). The dependent calculated field [Max Date] was implemented inline using WEEKDAY(TODAY()) and SWITCH to match the original weekday-based date logic. All column references use the 'table'[column] format for 'migration_Extract_POC (1) (local copy)'[RpDate]. The measure returns 1 or 0 to match the Tableau output.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references Tableau parameters, and all parameter-based calculations must be measures.
